crm:P7_took_place_at: The icon belongs to a group of six portable icons that were painted by Michael Damaskinos, after his return from Venice to Heraklion, Crete, in 1584 (?).§Everything beside the longest inscription is covered with a subsequent varnish layer. For this reason we suppose the overpaintings took place the year 1848 or before. Overpaintings: all inscriptions beside "The hand of Michael Dmaskinos", small areas at hair and faces of angels, the biggest part of their wings, the biggest part of the buildings and of the green curtain, the the red decorative zone, small areas at the figures of the Apostles and Christ, like at the hair of Saint Peter, Saint Andrew and of the white child and at the garment of Saint Matthew. Also, the golden background and the halo have been covered with a new gold leaf.
